lexUnit.name: pardon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a remission of the legal consequences of an offence or conviction.

sentence.text: A bill to grant posthumous pardons to all three hundred and seven British soldiers who were executed in the first world war , has gained a formal first reading in the house of commons .
THE PRIME Minister yesterday ruled out posthumous pardons for more than 300 British soldiers executed for cowardice and desertion during the First World War .
